main event: Two unidentified light phenomena were observed in Conrad, Montana on March 21, 1953, for a duration of 40 seconds.
interesting points: The sighting occurred in daylight conditions,The objects appeared to move slowly and interacted with normal meteorological conditions,There was no radar pickup reported for the sighting,The conclusion reached was an astronomical identification,The report includes additional analysis and communications regarding other related sightings.
sighted object: two light phenomena in the sky
